Robert Capa.Action: Carries out duties as a career physicist aboard the ICARUS II, demonstrating knowledge necessary for the mission.
Appears thin, young, nervy, and unkempt, suggesting possible lack of confidence or composure under pressure.
Concentrates intensely during a long chess game lasting three and a half hours, demonstrating perseverance and focus.
Recognizes when to resign by tipping over his king, showing good judgment and understanding of the situation.
Appears unkempt and nervy, with a couple of weeks beard growth and bedraggled hair, which might suggest a lack of attention to personal presentation.
Records a heartfelt, sincere video message to family expressing love and respect for his sister and joking warmly to lighten the mood.
Sits alone in the comms cubicle and records a personal, heartfelt message to his family, showing emotional intelligence and self-awareness.
Engages in a somewhat informal and playful tone during a critical moment, possibly undermining the gravity of the situation.
Sends a heartfelt recording with a kiss and accepts uncertainty, showing vulnerability before pressing SEND instead of DELETE.
Presses the 'SEND' button decisively after hesitation, choosing to transmit an important recording despite his apparent emotional conflict.
Hovers finger indecisively between DELETE and SEND buttons, showing momentary hesitation and internal struggle.
Engages physically in a fight with Mace, shows stubbornness but also endurance by withstanding being thrown and punched.
Takes three quarters of an hour to complete a task, causing frustration to others.
Apologizes immediately after being confronted, showing awareness of impact of his actions.
Sits alone in the recreation room with a split lip; appears quietly remorseful after an incident.
Apologizes to Mace and admits he should have let him go first.
Sits alone quietly with a small injury (split lip) that has already dried, showing endurance and control.
Expresses sincere apology to Mace and accepts the exchange of apologies maturely.
Sits silently when Mace talks about losing temper and personal issues, showing composure.
Does not appear to challenge Mace or escalate tensions, indicating emotional intelligence.
No explicit demonstration of decisive or skillful action in excerpt; primarily reactive and introspective moments.
Undecided about risking mission to help Icarus One crew, showing internal conflict and hesitation.
Is undecided during a critical risk assessment and mission discussion, hesitating to commit to a definitive stance.
Presses the button to activate the hologram of his pet dog Maxwell, showing a personal, tender moment.
Stands alone with a blank face after missing a difficult billiard shot, showing internal frustration or self-reflection but no interaction with others.
Greets Cassie with a friendly 'Hey' after noticing she was watching him.
Breaks off a kiss to check on a noise in the foliage, showing attentiveness and care.
Watches Cassie with a friendly gaze and notices the subtle blankness in her smile, suggesting emotional sensitivity.
Voices concern about contravening multiple directives during an intimate moment, indicating conscientiousness but also hesitation.
Breaks off from a kiss to check a suspicious noise despite intimate moment, showing alertness and situational awareness.
Expresses concern about contravening multiple directives but eventually relents under Cassie's influence.
Does not appear or act in the given excerpt, no direct actions or statements to evaluate competence.
Successfully makes two of the frozen scales fully upright and nearly completes the third, demonstrating effective hands-on skill and perseverance under challenging conditions.
Participates proactively and coordinates with Asher and others in managing a critical manual task when computer control is failing, showing teamwork and situational awareness.
Looks back over his shoulder at Asher, considers moving but hesitates instead of immediately fleeing, indicating concern for the situation and possibly Asher.
Works steadily on panels under extreme pressure while remaining calm and observant.
Hesitates briefly before heading back to the airlock despite increasing danger, showing situational awareness and measured decision-making.
Looks back over shoulder as panels move back down, indicating attentiveness and cautiousness.
Initially doesn't leave immediately on Asher's command, suggesting a slight delay or hesitation under pressure.
Collapses against the airlock door and slides down to the floor, helmet off.
Asks relevant, clarifying questions about the status of Icarus I's systems and atmosphere, showing awareness and cautious inquiry.
Monitors the flashlight-cam footage closely from the flight deck during the boarding operation, displaying attentiveness and involvement.
Expresses concern about the burial of crew members, communicates over radio actively seeking answers.
Asks why the ship's computer was shut down permanently, showing curiosity and engagement with the situation.
Responds to Mace's question with 'Zt wait to die,' indicating resignation and lack of proactive plan.
Runs quickly through ICARUS II to the airlock upon hearing an alarm, presses his face to the glass to assess the situation outside.
Reactively inspects the open airlock doors and damaged hull, demonstrating situational awareness under pressure.
Tips over the chess king and then violently sweeps the pieces across the room in frustration.
Composes himself after being startled while looking at Trey having a nightmare.
Reassures Searle that they will come back for him after the payload, showing concern for his safety.
Ignores Searle’s despair and refusal to survive, continuing to give instructions to save the ship.
Questions others about Trey’s death, pressing for truth despite silence and denial.
Displays quiet anger and insistence on accountability, but does not show empathy toward the grieving or shocked others.
Questions the group directly and assertively to identify who killed Trey, showing initiative and leadership in a tense situation.
Accuses others hastily without evidence, which might escalate tensions and not resolve the situation effectively.
Fills a glass of water and sits opposite Cassie, wanting to say something but hesitating.
Sits silently when Cassie ignores him and leaves without looking at him.
Watches Cassie and Mace having sex through a frosted partition.
Engages in calm discussion about grim survival odds and questions the AI Icarus about oxygen calculations, showing awareness and insistence on accurate information.
Initially accepts the grim scenario, showing some emotional acceptance but still seeks clarity, reflecting reasonable confidence under pressure.
Fails to immediately realize there are still five crew members, showing a crucial oversight in counting survivors in a high-stakes situation.
Yells 'Icarus! Full sunlight!' to flood the room with light, interrupting an attack.
Gives a thumbs up to Corazon after she helps arrange override of airlock door.
Gesticulates wildly to warn Corazon about Pinbacker approaching with a metal bar, attempting to communicate danger.
Unable to open the manually sealed airlock door due to lack of directive and overlooks the need to bypass it independently.
Gesticulates wildly to warn about approaching danger, attempting to communicate urgency despite communication barriers.
Shouts and tries to stop Pinbacker from attacking Corazon, showing concern and panic for her safety.
Insists on securing a weapon to survive and protect the mission, prioritizing survival yet still caring about others.
Interrupts Mace with urgency to warn about Pinbacker attacking Corazon, showing situational awareness and concern.
Attempts to coordinate with Mace and Icarius to find Cassie and Pinbacker, showing initiative and leadership.
Recognizes the importance of acquiring a weapon and insists on retrieving one before pursuing further, prioritizing survival and mission objectives.
Quickly adapts when the handgun is missing by finding and improvising a weapon (broken champagne bottle), demonstrating resourcefulness.
Expresses desperate panic when Corazon is attacked, momentarily losing composure.
Moves stealthily down the corridor clutching a broken bottle neck, cautiously enters the payload bay.
Tries to get Mace's attention when he finds him injured, showing situational awareness and concern.
Calls out to Cassie to stop shooting and attempts to explain the situation under pressure, showing presence of mind and communication skills.
Scurries for cover after Cassie fires shots, indicating a reactive rather than aggressive stance in dangerous situation.
Fails to prevent further escalation with Cassie despite attempts to reason, possibly indicating limited influence or authority in tense moment.
Yells Cassie's name in alarm when she is in danger.
Attempts to ward off Pinbacker to protect himself and possibly others.
Drops to his knees, cries openly, admits fear and vulnerability.
Expresses confusion and philosophical questioning about God and existence, showing sincerity and openness.
Keeps Pinbacker talking to figure out what to do next.
Helps set the countdown timer in the cockpit, assisting the pilot.
Shakes hands with opponent after resigning in chess game.
Engages in friendly small talk about the length and difficulty of the chess game.
Asks a direct, relevant question about the whereabouts of others, showing awareness and engagement.
Takes an ambitious and difficult billiards shot reflecting his inclination to take risks and attempt skillful moves.
Misses the billiards shot by a small margin, showing a rare lapse or failure in execution.
Is undecided and appears unsure when the group looks to him to make a technical decision, indicated by his muttered 'Shit.'
Lies awake alone, staring at the ceiling, suggesting possible anxiety or mental distraction rather than confident problem-solving.
Volunteers promptly for a dangerous task despite clear fear (sweat and tightness).
Looks directly into Cassie’s eyes seeking personal reassurance before suiting up.
Volunteers to take a risky task despite visible fear (sweat on hairline), confirms readiness by saying 'Okay, I'll do it.'
Appears tight and scared when donning the bulky spacesuit but acknowledges prior training, showing self-awareness and acceptance of difficulty.
Seeks reassurance from Cassie with a meaningful look, indicating some doubt or need for emotional support.
Looks thoughtfully at Asher's family hologram photo, indicating a reflective connection to others' personal lives.
Sits watching Trey quietly in the med-center, showing attentiveness and concern for a vulnerable crew member.
Responds to Cassie's question about Searle with a somewhat light-hearted comment about him being the happiest crew member due to tranquillisers.
Asks Cassie sincerely if she still thinks he made the right decision regarding Trey, showing openness to feedback.
Laughs with surprise rather than anger or hostility when Cassie suggests letting crew members die to conserve oxygen.
Shows a moment of threatened emotion when Cassie implies crew members might need to die but does not overreact or lash out.
Responds to Cassie's question about Searle with calm, informed assessment of his condition.
Shrugs when asked about Trey's condition, indicating some uncertainty or emotional detachment.
Seeks confirmation about the correctness of a prior decision, showing willingness to reflect on his choices.
Laughs with surprise on hearing a severe implication about the crew needing to be reduced, possibly showing discomfort or disbelief.
Is identified by Cassie as the most needed person to supervise the payload delivery, implying recognition of his skill and importance.
Shows concern and careful inquiry about who Corazon confided in, implying vigilance and attentiveness to critical information.
Remains silently listening and composed during a heated argument, showing control and patience.
Exhibits visible physical deterioration (skin falling off, half blind), leading others to doubt his usefulness.
Asks relevant, insightful questions over the radio about the shutdown of the ship's computer, showing alertness and engagement with the problem.
Does not take direct physical action but facilitates communication and information gathering via radio, indicating reliance on others rather than independent action.
Studies the chessboard thoughtfully before abruptly tipping over the king and violently sweeping the pieces across the room.
Opens the observation room door and instinctively shields his face from the intense brightness, then commands a reset to lower the light.
Quietly watches over Trey in the med center, composing himself after being startled by Mace's presence and showing restraint despite the tense situation.
Tries to give clear instructions to Searle to orient the hull breach away from the sun as the only way to survive.
Ignores Searle's despair and refusal to focus on survival, continuing to attempt communication.
Fails to convince Searle or prevent the situation from deteriorating as the communication breaks down and Searle prepares for the explosion.
Expresses dark acceptance of likely death, showing no bitterness but a grim, resolute calm.
Shows concern about the return trip, implying empathy toward others' suffering.
Suggests letting their bodies be taken back to families, indicating care for others and their loved ones.
Does not display bitterness or blame toward the situation or others, maintaining composure.
Struggles to put on space suit alone, then uses sheer determination and pain tolerance to forcibly secure helmet, enabling himself to proceed despite impossibility.
Lies on the geodesic dome shouting and waving arms, a seemingly futile attempt to get Corazon's attention.
Calls out to Mace urgently, shows concern when Mace collapses.
Attempts to communicate with Cassie to stop shooting, insists he didn't kill anyone and tries to explain calmly.
Scurries for cover after being shot at, shows survival instinct without aggression.
Recognizes the scientific fact that the next nearest star is 1.6 light years away and attempts to question the logic behind giving up on saving the sun.
Almost getting angry and not fully understanding or accepting the fatalistic philosophy presented by Pinbacker.
Stalls for more time when Mace, wounded and weak, tries to raise a gun behind Pinbacker.
Encourages Mace to learn chess despite Mace's initial lack of skill and offers guidance on moves.
Acknowledges Mace's enthusiasm and praises his progress ('You’re getting the hang').
Initiates the chess game with a common, well-known opening move, demonstrating knowledge of the game.
Gives helpful and encouraging advice to Mace about developing pieces and learning chess, showing patient teaching ability.
Acknowledges Mace's limitations realistically but supports his desire to learn, indicating thoughtful judgment.
